Easy coverage track visualization

Source: R/ez_wrappers.R
ez_coverage.Rd

This function creates a coverage track visualization from various input types. It provides a flexible interface with support for grouping and multiple tracks.

Usage

ez_coverage(
  input,
  region,
  track_labels = NULL,
  type = c("area", "line", "heatmap"),
  fill = "steelblue",
  group_var = NULL,
  color_by = c("group", "track"),
  colors = NULL,
  y_axis_style = c("none", "simple", "full"),
  y_range = NULL,
  alpha = 0.5,
  bin_width = NULL,
  facet_label_position = c("top", "left"),
  ...
)

Arguments

input

A data frame, character vector of file paths, or named list of data sources

region

Genomic region to display (e.g., "chr1:1000000-2000000")

track_labels

Optional vector of track labels (used for character vector input)

type

Type of signal visualization: "line", "area", or "heatmap" (default: "area")

fill

Fill color for area plots (default: "steelblue"). Can be a vector for multiple colors.

group_var

Column name for grouping data within a single data frame (default: NULL)

color_by

Whether colors distinguish "group" or "track" (default: "group")

colors

Color palette for groups/tracks. If NULL, uses default palette (default: NULL)

y_axis_style

Y-axis style: "none", "simple", or "full" (default: "none")

y_range

Y-axis range limits (default: NULL)

alpha

Transparency (default: 0.5)

bin_width

Width of bins in base pairs (default: NULL)

facet_label_position

Position of facet labels: "top" or "left" (default: "top")

...

Additional arguments passed to geom_coverage

Value

A ggplot2 object

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Single data frame with grouping
df <- data.frame(
  seqnames = "chr1", start = 1:100, end = 1:100,
  score = rnorm(100), sample = rep(c("A", "B"), 50)
)
ez_coverage(df, "chr1:1-100", group_var = "sample")

# Character vector of files
ez_coverage(c("sample1.bw", "sample2.bw"), "chr1:1-100")

# Named list with stacking
ez_coverage(
  list(
    "ATAC-seq" = "atac.bw",
    "H3K27ac" = "h3k27ac.bw",
    "H3K4me3" = c("rep1.bw", "rep2.bw")
  ),
  "chr1:1-100"
)
} # }
